item.title: Do You Need a Content Delivery Network?
item.description: The way we deliver content online is evolving rapidly. While you could once manage a website with just a computer and a few phone lines, today’s high-definition video and nationwide audiences demand far more resources. This is where content delivery networks (CDNs) come in. Think of a CDN as a specialized web hosting service. Just as you can host your website on your own server or outsource it, you can also choose between managing your content distribution or relying on a CDN.

item.title: Kinoma Mobile Media Tools
item.description: The mobile multimedia revolution is here, as evidenced by the constant competition among cell phone manufacturers to deliver bigger screens, better resolution, more memory, and faster wireless speeds. However, Kinoma is changing the game with a new toolset that enhances the capabilities of existing smartphones. At the forefront is Kinoma Play, a multimedia browser and guide. It supports a wide array of video formats, including MPEG-4 Video SP, AVC/H.264, 3GPP (MPEG-4), Flash Video (Sorenson Spark), QuickTime Movie (MPEG-4), and Windows Media 9 (WMV9).
